movies.title: Altar
movies.plot: The Hamilton family move into a large country house on the Yorkshire Moors to supervise its restoration from a dilapidated B&B to the original Victorian grandeur. When Meg Hamilton, wife, mother and renovation expert first loses her London team after an accident, then a local Yorkshire team too superstitious to continue, she's forced to carry on alone. The discovery of a secret attic room, a Rosicrucian mosaic, a bricked up root cellar and many other unexplainable events gradually convince Meg, her husband Alec and children Penny and Harper, that they're not only restoring the house, but also its original Victorian owners who died 150 years ago. But before they can escape, the house - and its former occupants - force them to spend one last, terrifying night under its roof.
movies.simplePlot: A young family move to an isolated house which the wife has been hired to restore, only to discover that the previous owner is reputed to have murdered his wife.

biography.bio: Olivia Williams was born July 26, 1968 in Camden Town, London. She was educated at South Hampstead High School, an independent school for girls in Hampstead, North London, followed by Newnham College at the University of Cambridge. She graduated with a degree in English literature. She went on to study drama at the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School for two years and spent three years at the Royal Shakespeare Company. After having made appearances in several theater productions, her first significant appearance in the made-for-television film Emma (1996), based on Jane Austen's 1816 novel. She made her film debut in The Postman (1997), and went on to play the part of Rosemary Cross in Wes Anderson's Rushmore (1998), Bruce Willis's wife in M. Night Shyamalan's The Sixth Sense (1999), Madeleine in The Heart of Me (2002) (for which she won the British Independent Film Award for Best Actress), and Ruth Lang in Roman Polanski's The Ghost Writer (2010). Her performance earned her ALFS, and NSFC Awards.
biography.name: Olivia Williams

biography.bio: The youngest of seven, Matthew was born in Loma Linda, Ca, to Dolores (Warner), a bookkeeper, and Mark Alexander Modine, a drive-in theater manager. After graduating high school in Imperial Beach, Ca. Modine moved to NYC (1979). Matthew studied with Stella Adler at her Conservatory of Acting. While still a student of hers, he began landing starring roles in film, and later theatre and television. Matthew has worked with many of the most highly regarded directors including, Christopher Nolan, Oliver Stone, Sir Alan Parker, Stanley Kubrick, Robert Altman, Abel Ferrara, Alan J. Pakula, John Schlesinger, Tony Richardson, Robert Falls, Sir Peter Hall, Spike Lee, Tom DiCillo, Mike Figgis, Jonathan Demme and John Sayles. A partial list of his films include: The Dark Knight Rises (2012), Birdy (1984), Vision Quest (1985), Full Metal Jacket (1987), Married to the Mob (1988), Gross Anatomy (1989), Memphis Belle (1990), Pacific Heights (1990), Short Cuts (1993), The Browning Version (1994) and Any Given Sunday (1999). Matthew is the recipient of a Golden Globe Award, Venice Film Festival Volpi Cup and Golden Lion. Mary (2005), directed by Abel Ferrara, co-starring Juliette Binoche and Forest Whitaker, won the Special Jury Prize at the Venice Film Festival. Birdy won the Cannes Film Festival Gran Prix. Equinox (1992), directed by Alan Rudolph, received four Independent Spirit Award nominations including Best Actor and Best Film. For his work in television, Matthew was part of the Emmy winning Showtime series Weeds (2005). He has received Golden Globe and Emmy Award nominations for the M.O.W. What the Deaf Man Heard (1997) and HBO's Emmy winning And the Band Played On (1993). Modine has directed several distinguished short films: When I Was a Boy (1993), Smoking (1994), Ecce Pirate (1997), I Think I Thought (2008) and To Kill an American (2008).
biography.name: Matthew Modine

biography.bio: Antonia Clarke is an actress, known for Magic in the Moonlight (2014), Les Misérables (2012) and Altar (2014).
biography.name: Antonia Clarke

biography.bio: Adam Thomas Wright was born on 8th November 2000 in Essex. He has appeared in several feature films Adam has had a varied career including T.V. Drama, Presenting and Radio work. He has also appeared in the theatre production of Lord of the Flies in London's Regent Park Open Air Theatre. He won Best Newcomer Award at The Monaco International Film Festival in December 2014 for his role in the film Lady Luck.
biography.name: Adam Thomas Wright

biography.bio: Richard Dillane was the last of four children born near London to an Australian father and English mother. He went to Langley Park School in Beckenham and Manchester University where he gained a first class degree in philosophy, and then emigrated to Australia where he has citizenship through his father. His professional debut was at the Western Australian Theatre Company in Perth and in 1987 he played Hamlet directed by Ray Omodei. While in Australia, besides acting and other work such as being a wilderness white water rafting guide in Tasmania, he directed plays and assisted on operatic and musical productions before returning to the UK in 1994 where his screen career began. He and his actress wife Jayne McKenna have three children, all boys.
biography.name: Richard Dillane

biography.bio: Howard Lee is an actor, known for Lagaan (2001), Altar (2014) and The Pride of Wade Ellison (2011).
biography.name: Howard Lee

biography.bio: Jonathan Jaynes is an actor, known for First Knight (1995), The Numbers Station (2013) and Altar (2014).
biography.name: Jonathan Jaynes

biography.bio: Rebecca Calder is an actress, known for Youth (2015), Love Me Do (2015) and Altar (2014).
biography.name: Rebecca Calder

biography.bio: Steve Oram was born on August 25, 1973 in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire, England. He is an actor and writer, known for Sightseers (2012), The World's End (2013) and The Canal (2014).
biography.name: Steve Oram

biography.bio: David J. Peel is known for his work on Altar (2014), The Selfish Giant (2013) and Stalled (2014).
biography.name: David J. Peel

biography.bio: Mark Heenehan is an actor, known for Teletubbies Everywhere (2002), Teletubbies (1997) and Teletubbies: Silly Songs and Funny Dances (2002).
biography.name: Mark Heenehan

biography.bio: Stephen Chance is an actor, known for Me Before You (2016), Gallipoli - La bataille des Dardanelles (2013) and Altar (2014).
biography.name: Stephen Chance

keywords: cutting the palm of one's hand
